        Saves the input keywords and the resulting LLH or word Frequencies to a CSV (or any other text) file format. This methods creates two columns only taking two arrays as input.

      • saveResultsToCSVThreeColumns

        public static void saveResultsToCSVThreeColumns(java.lang.String[] keywords,
                                double[] LLH,
                                double[] freq,
                                java.lang.String outputFile)
                                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Saves the input keywords and the resulting LLH and word Frequencies to a CSV (or any other text) file format. This methods creates three columns taking three arrays as input. it's a String[] double[] double[] method but can be easily modified to accept other types.
        Parameters:
        keywords -
        LLH -
        freq -
        outputFile -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
